Texts.Eng: Find Clues to Locate the Floran Artifact
Interesting find! Keep going, you're doing well!
Interesting that they should value such an item, and display it in this way.

Now that you're familiar with scanning, ^green;we need to start finding these ^orange;artifacts^white;, dear. Yes, the Floran one first... Their colonies will contain vital ^orange;clues^reset; to its whereabouts. Floran live all over nowadays, but still prefer the dense ^orange;forest^white; vegetation of planets found around ^orange;gentle stars^white;. Good luck dear, and thank you.
The Floran don't pay much attention to history, but they greatly value tradition. It's helpful to build a picture of the culture.
The creature that these remains belonged to aren't native to this area - I'll look through my taxonomic records and see if I can discover its origins and importance.
This glutinous webbing is of unusual hue and texture. The species that produced it must be unique in its characteristics, and probably limited in its environment.
This image depicts a Floran hunter, their garb seems almost ceremonial.
This spinneret is unusually large - what kind of creature could support such an organ? This is evidently a prized trophy. I wonder...
Traditional Floran culture places great importance on their hunts and their hunters... I'm certain that will have an impact upon the location of their artifact.'.
Violence reigns in Floran culture - sometimes disorderly, sometimes organised in nature.
Wonderful - I believe I now know just where the Artifact might be! ^#71f2f6;Come and meet me back at the Ark when you're ready^white;, dear.
You did it! That was the last clue we needed. I know just where the Floran artifact is now.
You're quite the collector of Floran antiquities! It appears you've already located enough clues to to allow me to identify the location of the Artifact!
